questions.question: What is the purpose of adding inputs to a custom block in Scratch?

options.text: To allow the block to work with different values without rewriting it
To make Scratch look more colorful

questions.question: What is an input in a custom block?

options.text: A way to add color to a sprite
A value that you pass to the block to customize its behavior
A message that appears when the sprite talks

questions.question: How can you edit an existing custom block to add more inputs?

options.text: Right-click on the block and select "Edit"
Drag the block to a different part of the screen
Use the “Ask and Wait” block to modify it
Delete the block and create a new one

questions.question: If you use what happens?

options.text: Changes the color of the sprite
Increases the size of the sprite
